intro: Pavetta permodesta, commonly known as the slender pavetta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in clusters, often blooming during the dry season.
